guidePage.title: User Guide
guidePage.subtitle: Learn how to get the most out of MenuScore

start.title: Getting Started
start.intro: Welcome to MenuScore. This guide will help you start optimizing your menu quickly and easily.

step1.title: 1. Download the app
step1.desc: MenuScore is available on iOS and Android. Download it from your favorite app store.

step2.title: 2. Start using the app
step2.desc: No need to create an account or register. Open the app and start adding your dishes and ingredients directly.

step3.title: 3. The 4 main sections
step3.desc: MenuScore is organized into 4 tabs at the bottom:
items: Menu: View and manage all your dishes
Ingredients: Manage ingredient prices and stock
Sales: Record what you sell each week
Dashboard: View charts and business evolution

menu.title: Your Menu
menu.intro: In the Menu section you will see all your dishes organized by categories and your menu's MenuScore rating.

score.title: The MenuScore rating
score.desc: At the top of the Menu section you will see a number from 0 to 100 representing the overall health of your entire menu:
items: 80-100: Excellent - Your menu is very well balanced
60-79: Good - There is room for improvement but it works well
40-59: Fair - Check some dishes
0-39: Needs attention - There are problems to solve
score.note: Tap the score to see what factors affect it and how to improve it. This score evaluates your set of dishes as a whole, not each individual dish.

add.title: Add a new dish
add.desc: Tap the + button and fill in:
items: Name of the dish (as it appears on the menu)
Selling price (including VAT)
Category (Starters, Mains, etc.)
Estimated effort (VERY IMPORTANT - affects cost)
Ingredients - Select from catalog and set exact quantities

effort.title: Estimated Effort (very important)
effort.desc: This field indicates how much kitchen effort the dish requires. It directly affects the calculated cost because it multiplies the operating cost per minute.
items: Minimal: Green salad, cheese board, pre-made gazpacho
Quick: Fried eggs, simple grill, sandwich
Normal: Pasta, grilled meats with garnish, simple rice dishes
Complex: Sauces made to order, slow cooking, multiple techniques
effort.example: Example with â‚¬6,600/month operating cost and 200h: Minimal adds â‚¬0.55, Quick â‚¬1.10, Normal â‚¬2.20, Complex â‚¬4.40. The difference is huge!
effort.tip: Tip: Be honest. If a dish requires work, mark it. Better to know that an elaborate dish has less margin than you thought.

info.title: Dish information
info.desc: When you tap a dish you will see:
items: Selling price - What you charge the customer
Real cost - What it costs you to prepare (ingredients + labor)
Margin - How much you earn with each dish (in â‚¬ and %)
Recommended price - If the margin is low, it suggests a better price
Classification - Star, Plowhorse, Puzzle or Dog

classification.title: Dish classification
classification.desc: Each dish receives a label based on its performance:
items: Star: High sales AND high margin - Perfect! Keep it highlighted
Plowhorse: High sales BUT low margin - Reduce costs if possible
Puzzle: High margin BUT low sales - Promote it more
Dog: Low sales AND low margin - Consider removing it
Review: A dish that was popular has stopped being so - Analyze what happened
classification.review_tip: When a dish changes role (e.g., goes from Star to Review), the app notifies you to investigate.

suggestions.title: Smart suggestions
suggestions.desc: MenuScore analyzes your menu and gives you personalized advice like:
items: "Mushroom Risotto has good margin but low sales. Highlight it more on the menu?"
"Burger has no added ingredients. Add them to calculate real cost"
"Caesar Salad sales dropped this week. What happened?"

edit.title: Edit or delete dishes
items: Tap the dish you want to edit
Its info card will open with all the details
Modify name, price, ingredients or category
Save changes
edit.delete: To delete a dish, swipe left or use the options menu.

simulation.title: Sales simulation
simulation.desc: Analyze how different scenarios would affect your margins:
items: From a dish's detail, access Simulate sales
Adjust the number of units sold per week
Visualize how your total margin would change
Useful for deciding which dishes to promote

ingredients.title: Ingredients
ingredients.intro: Manage your ingredient catalog to calculate precise costs for each dish. You'll only see ingredients you're using in some dish.

add.title: Add ingredients
items: From catalog: MenuScore includes hundreds of common ingredients. Search, add and set your price
Create new: If not in catalog, create it from scratch

config.title: Configure an ingredient
items: Purchase price: What you pay the supplier
Purchase quantity: In what quantity you buy it (1 kg, 5 liters, 6 units...)
Cooking unit: How you measure it in recipes (grams, ml, units...)
config.example: Example with oil: You buy 5L for â‚¬25, use ml in recipes. MenuScore calculates: â‚¬25 Ã· 5000ml = â‚¬0.005/ml. If you use 20ml in a dish = â‚¬0.10.

prices.title: Why update prices
prices.desc: Your dish costs depend directly on ingredient prices.
prices.example: Example: If salmon goes from â‚¬15/kg to â‚¬20/kg and you don't update it, MenuScore still calculates the old cost. Your real margin has dropped but you don't know it.
prices.tip: Recommendation: Review prices at least once a month. Those that fluctuate a lot (fish, seasonal vegetables), more often.

analysis.title: Ingredient analysis ("Insights" tab)
items: Best sellers: Which ingredients you move most - useful for negotiating with suppliers
Most profitable: Which ingredients contribute most to your revenue
At-risk: Only used in one dish - if it doesn't sell, the ingredient sits idle
Inventory value: How much money you have "tied up" in ingredients (with stock enabled)

sales.title: Sales
sales.intro: Record your dish sales to analyze real popularity and improve classification.

why.title: Why record sales?
why.desc: MenuScore needs to know what you actually sell to:
items: Correctly classify each dish (Star, Plowhorse, etc.)
Show you trends in the Dashboard
Give you more precise advice
Automatically deduct stock (if enabled)

rule.title: The Golden Rule
rule.desc: Record sales once a week. The system works with weekly accumulated totals, not daily.

how.title: How to record sales
items: Go to the Sales tab
Select the week you want to record (usually the previous one)
Tap + to open the record
Indicate the total units sold that week for each dish
Save
how.tip: Tip: It doesn't have to be 100% exact. If you don't have POS data, a reasonable estimate ("about 30 burgers") is better than nothing.

csv.title: Import from CSV file
csv.desc: If you have data in a CSV file (e.g., from your POS):
items: Tap the import icon
Select your CSV file
MenuScore automatically matches names
Review and confirm

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.intro: Visualize your business evolution with interactive charts.

charts.title: Available charts
items: Revenue per week: Am I billing more or less than before?
Units sold: Am I selling more dishes?
Margin: Is my profitability improving or worsening?

compare.title: Compare dishes
compare.desc: You can select up to 2 dishes to compare their evolution:
items: "Is the burger selling more than last month?"
"Which dish has a better trend?"

periods.title: Periods
periods.desc: Choose to view the last 4, 8 or 12 weeks.

categories.title: Categories
categories.intro: Organize your menu with custom categories.

manage.title: Manage categories
manage.desc: From the side menu you can:
items: Create new categories (Starters, Mains, Desserts, Drinks, etc.)
Rename existing ones
Reorder with drag and drop
Delete ones you no longer use

stock.title: Stock Control (Optional)
stock.intro: Control your ingredient inventory and receive alerts when something is low.

benefits.title: What does it add?
items: See how much you have of each ingredient
Automatically deducted when you record sales
Alerts when something is below minimum
Inventory value in real-time

config.title: Configure stock
config.desc: For each ingredient you can define:
items: Current stock: How much you have now
Minimum stock: When we alert you

recurring.title: Recurring stock
items: Enable "Recurring stock"
Indicate weekly amount
MenuScore automatically adds it every Monday
recurring.example: Example: If you get 3 kegs of beer every Monday, configure it here and forget about adding it manually.

backup.title: Backup and Restore
backup.intro: Protect your data by exporting backups.

export.title: Export backup
items: Export all your data to a file
Save it on your mobile or cloud
Useful before changing phones

restore.title: Restore data
restore.desc: If you change phones or lose data:
items: Select your backup file
MenuScore restores everything: dishes, ingredients, sales, categories

settings.title: Settings
settings.intro: Configure these parameters before starting. They directly affect how MenuScore calculates your dish costs.

operating_cost.title: Monthly Operating Cost (â‚¬)
operating_cost.desc: The total of all your monthly fixed expenses (rent, payroll, utilities, insurance...).
operating_cost.example: Example: Rent â‚¬1,500 + Payroll â‚¬4,000 + Utilities â‚¬800 + Others â‚¬300 = â‚¬6,600/month

opening_hours.title: Monthly Opening Hours
opening_hours.desc: How many hours the venue is open per month. MenuScore uses this to calculate cost per minute.

overhead.title: Overhead / General Expenses (%)
overhead.desc: An extra percentage to cover variable or unforeseen expenses (waste, breakage, extra cleaning) not included in the monthly cost.
overhead.example: Between 5% and 15% depending on your waste control.

beverages.title: Beverage Profit (%)
beverages.desc: The percentage of your total revenue that comes from drinks (sodas, wine, coffee...).

vat.title: VAT (%)
vat.desc: The VAT percentage included in your sales prices (usually 10% in Spain).

lang.title: Language
items: EspaÃ±ol
English

q1.q: Why does my margin seem very low?
q1.a: Check: 1. Correct monthly operating cost? 2. Correct opening hours? 3. Realistic overhead? 4. Correct ingredient quantities?

q2.q: Why do my dishes say 'No data'?
q2.a: Because you haven't recorded sales. Classification (Star, Plowhorse...) needs sales data to work.

q3.q: Can I use the app without recording sales?
q3.a: Yes, but you lose dish classification, Dashboard, and suggestions are less precise.

q4.q: What happens if I don't add ingredients?
q4.a: Cost will be only labor + overhead. Margin will look huge but it will be fake.

checklist.title: Initial Checklist
items: Configure monthly operating cost (â‚¬)
Configure monthly opening hours
Configure overhead (%)
Configure VAT (%)
Create all categories
Add all dishes
Add ingredients with real quantities
Update ingredient prices

routine.title: Recommended Routine
routine.weekly: Weekly (5 min): Record sales, check stock, check Dashboard.
routine.monthly: Monthly (15 min): Check ingredient prices, read suggestions, backup.
routine.quarterly: Quarterly (30 min): Deep analysis, remove Plowhorses, adjust prices.

cta.title: Need more help?
cta.subtitle: Contact us and we'll help you get the most out of MenuScore

contact.title: Contact
contact.subtitle: Have any questions? We're here to help

intro.title: Summary
intro.text: MenuScore is an application designed to help you manage your restaurant menu. Your privacy is important to us. This policy explains what data we process and how we do it.
intro.highlight: Most importantly: MenuScore does NOT collect personal data. All your dish, ingredient and sales information is stored only on your device.

local.title: Data stored on your device (we do NOT collect it)
local.text: All information you enter in MenuScore is stored exclusively on your device:
items: Dishes, prices and categories
Ingredients and their costs
Sales records
Settings and preferences
local.note: This data never leaves your device. We have no access to it and do not store it on any server.

analytics.title: Anonymous analytics data (Firebase Analytics)
analytics.text: We use Google's Firebase Analytics to understand how the app is used and improve it. This information is completely anonymous and may include:
items: Device model and operating system version
Country/region (approximate)
Usage events (which features are used, not what data you enter)
Error information to fix bugs
analytics.note: This information does NOT allow us to identify you personally.

nodatacollection.title: 3. Data we do NOT collect
items: Name, email or contact details
Payment or banking information
Precise location
Photos, contacts or files from your device
Information about your dishes, ingredients or sales

thirdparty.title: 4. Third-party services
thirdparty.text: We use the following third-party services:

rights.title: 5. Your rights
rights.text: Under GDPR, you have the right to:
items: Access your data
Rectify incorrect data
Request deletion of your data
Object to processing
Data portability
rights.note: Since we don't store personal data on our servers, you can exercise these rights directly from your device by deleting the app or its data.

children.title: 6. Minors
children.text: MenuScore is designed for professional use in restaurants. It is not aimed at people under 16 years of age and we do not knowingly collect information from minors.

changes.title: 7. Changes to this policy
changes.text: We may update this policy occasionally. We will notify you of significant changes through the app or by posting the new policy on this page.

contact.title: 8. Contact
contact.text: If you have questions about this privacy policy, contact us:

intro.title: Introduction
intro.text: These terms and conditions govern the use of the MenuScore application. By downloading, installing or using the app, you accept these terms.

service.title: 1. Service description
service.text: MenuScore is a mobile application that helps you:
items: Manage your menu dishes
Calculate costs and margins for each dish
Record and analyze sales
Get suggestions to improve your menu
service.note: The app is currently free and works entirely on your device without internet connection or registration.

license.title: 2. License of use
license.text: We grant you a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable and revocable license to use MenuScore on your personal or business devices, subject to these terms.
items: Copy, modify or distribute the application
Reverse engineer or attempt to extract source code
Use the application for illegal purposes
Resell or sublicense the application

data.title: 3. Your data
data.text: All information you enter in MenuScore (dishes, ingredients, sales, etc.) is stored only on your device. You are solely responsible for:
items: Backing up your data
The accuracy of information entered
Maintaining the security of your device
data.warning: Important: If you uninstall the app or change devices without backing up, you will lose all data.

disclaimer.title: 4. Disclaimer
disclaimer.text: MenuScore is a management support tool. Calculations, suggestions and classifications are indicative:
items: They do not replace professional accounting or financial advice
Business decisions are your sole responsibility
We do not guarantee specific economic results
disclaimer.note: The application is provided "as is", without warranties of any kind.

liability.title: 5. Limitation of liability
liability.text: To the maximum extent permitted by law, we will not be liable for:
items: Direct, indirect, incidental or consequential damages arising from use of the application
Loss of data, profits or business interruption
Errors or inaccuracies in calculations
Decisions made based on information from the application

ip.title: 6. Intellectual property
ip.text: MenuScore, including its design, code, logos, icons and content, is protected by intellectual property rights. All rights not expressly granted are reserved.

changes.title: 7. Changes to the service
items: Modify, suspend or discontinue the application at any time
Update these terms (we will notify you of significant changes)
Add paid features in the future

termination.title: 8. Termination
termination.text: You can stop using MenuScore at any time by uninstalling the app. We reserve the right to revoke your access if you breach these terms.

law.title: 9. Governing law
law.text: These terms are governed by Spanish law. Any dispute will be submitted to the competent courts of Spain.

contact.title: 10. Contact
contact.text: If you have questions about these terms, contact us:
